<s> proposition in terms of certain letters </s>
<s> representation of propositions of existence the proposition some exist three other similar propositions the proposition no exist three other similar propositions the proposition some xy exist three other similar propositions the proposition no xy exist three other similar propositions the proposition no exist is double and is equivalent to the two propositions no xy exist and no xy exist pg xxi </s>
<s> representation of propositions of relations the proposition some are three other similar propositions the proposition some are three other similar propositions trio of equivalent propositions viz </s>
<s> some xy exist some are some are converse propositions and conversion three other similar trios the proposition no are three other similar propositions the proposition no are three other similar propositions trio of equivalent propositions viz </s>
<s> no xy exist no are no are three other similar trios the proposition all are is double and is equivalent to the two propositions some are and no are seven other similar propositions tables ii iii representation of propositions of existence and relation chapter iv </s>
<s> interpretation of biliteral diagram when marked with counters interpretation of and of three other similar arrangements pg xxii interpretation of and of three other similar arrangements interpretation of and of three other similar arrangements interpretation of and of three other similar arrangements interpretation of and of three other similar arrangements interpretation of and of seven other similar arrangements book iv the triliteral diagram chapter </s>
<s> symbols and cells change of biliteral into triliteral diagram the xy class subdivided into the xym class and the xym class pg xxiii the inner and outer cells of the north west quarter assigned to these classes the xy class the x'y class and the x'y class similarly subdivided the inner and outer cells of the north east the south west and the south east quarter similarly assigned the inner square and the outer border have thus been assigned to the class and the class rules for finding readily the compartment or cell assigned to any given attribute or attributes table iv attributes of classes and compartments or cells assigned to them chapter ii </s>
<s> representation of propositions in terms of and or of and </s>
<s> representation of propositions of existence in terms of and or of and the proposition some xm exist seven other similar propositions the proposition no xm exist seven other similar propositions </s>
<s> representation of propositions of relation in terms of and or of and the pair of converse propositions some are some are seven other similar pairs the pair of converse propositions no are no are seven other similar pairs the proposition all are fifteen other similar propositions tables vi vii viii representations of propositions in terms of and or of and to pg xxiv chapter iii </s>
<s> representation of two propositions of relation one in terms of and and the other in terms of and on the same diagram the digits and to be used instead of red and grey counters rules examples worked chapter iv </s>

<s> tables </s>
<s> words </s>
<s> explained pg xxxii pg book </s>
<s> things and their attributes </s>
<s> chapter </s>
<s> introductory the universe contains things for example london roses redness old english books the letter which received yesterday things have attributes for example large red old which received yesterday one thing may have many attributes and one attribute may belong to many things </s>
<s> thus the thing rose may have the attributes red scented full blown and the attribute red may belong to the things rose brick ribbon any attribute or any set of attributes may be called an adjunct this word is introduced in order to avoid the constant repetition of the phrase attribute or set of attributes thus we may say that rose has the attribute red or the adjunct red whichever we prefer or we may say that it has the adjunct red scented and full blown pg chapter ii </s>
<s> classification classification or the formation of classes is mental process in which we imagine that we have put together in group certain things </s>
<s> such group is called class this process may be performed in three different ways as follows we may imagine that we have put together all things </s>
<s> the class so formed </s>
<s> the class things contains the whole universe </s>
<s> we may think of the class things and may imagine that we have picked out from it all the things which possess certain adjunct not possessed by the whole class </s>
<s> this adjunct is said to be peculiar to the class so formed </s>
<s> in this case the class things is called genus with regard to the class so formed the class so formed is called species of the class things and its peculiar adjunct is called its differentia </s>
<s> pg as this process is entirely mental we can perform it whether there is or is not an existing thing which possesses that adjunct </s>
<s> if there is the class is said to be real if not it is said to be unreal or imaginary for example we may imagine that we have picked out from the class things all the things which possess the adjunct material artificial consisting of houses and streets and we may thus form the real class towns here we may regard things as genus towns as species of things and material artificial consisting of houses and streets as its differentia </s>
<s> again we may imagine that we have picked out all the things which possess the adjunct weighing ton easily lifted by baby and we may thus form the imaginary class things that weigh ton and are easily lifted by baby we may think of certain class not the class things and may imagine that we have picked out from it all the members of it which possess certain adjunct not possessed by the whole class </s>
<s> this adjunct is said to be peculiar to the smaller class so formed </s>
<s> in this case the class thought of is called genus with regard to the smaller class picked out from it the smaller class is called species of the larger and its peculiar adjunct is called its differentia </s>
<s> for example we may think of the class towns and imagine that we have picked out from it all the towns which possess the attribute lit with gas and we may thus form the real class towns lit with gas here we may regard towns as genus towns lit with gas as species of towns and lit with gas as its differentia </s>
<s> if in the above example we were to alter lit with gas into paved with gold we should get the imaginary class towns paved with gold class containing only one member is called an individual for example the class towns having four million inhabitants which class contains only one member viz </s>
<s> london pg hence any single thing which we can name so as to distinguish it from all other things may be regarded as one member class </s>
<s> thus london may be regarded as the one member class picked out from the class towns which has as its differentia having four million inhabitants class containing two or more members is sometimes regarded as one single thing </s>
<s> when so regarded it may possess an adjunct which is not possessed by any member of it taken separately </s>
<s> thus the class the soldiers of the tenth regiment when regarded as one single thing may possess the attribute formed in square which is not possessed by any member of it taken separately pg chapter iii </s>
<s> division </s>
<s> introductory division is mental process in which we think of certain class of things and imagine that we have divided it into two or more smaller classes </s>
<s> thus we might think of the class books and imagine that we had divided it into the two smaller classes bound books and unbound books or into the three classes books priced at less than shilling shilling books books priced at more than shilling or into the twenty six classes books whose names begin with books whose names begin with class that has been obtained by certain division is said to be codivisional with every class obtained by that division </s>
<s> thus the class bound books is codivisional with each of the two classes bound books and unbound books similarly the battle of waterloo may be said to have been contemporary with every event that happened in hence class obtained by division is codivisional with itself </s>
<s> thus the class bound books is codivisional with itself </s>
<s> similarly the battle of waterloo may be said to have been contemporary with itself pg </s>
<s> dichotomy if we think of certain class and imagine that we have picked out from it certain smaller class it is evident that the remainder of the large class does not possess the differentia of that smaller class </s>
<s> hence it may be regarded as another smaller class whose differentia may be formed from that of the class first picked out by prefixing the word not and we may imagine that we have divided the class first thought of into two smaller classes whose differenti are contradictory </s>
<s> this kind of division is called dichotomy </s>
<s> for example we may divide books into the two classes whose differenti are old and not old in performing this process we may sometimes find that the attributes we have chosen are used so loosely in ordinary conversation that it is not easy to decide which of the things belong to the one class and which to the other </s>
<s> in such case it would be necessary to lay down some arbitrary rule as to where the one class should end and the other begin </s>
<s> thus in dividing books into old and not old we may say let all books printed before </s>
<s> be regarded as old and all others as not old henceforwards let it be understood that if class of things be divided into two classes whose differenti have contrary meanings each differentia is to be regarded as equivalent to the other with the word not prefixed </s>
<s> thus if books be divided into old and new the attribute old is to be regarded as equivalent to not new and the attribute new as equivalent to not old pg after dividing class by the process of dichotomy into two smaller classes we may sub divide each of these into two still smaller classes and this process may be repeated over and over again the number of classes being doubled at each repetition </s>
<s> for example we may divide books into old and new </s>
<s> not old we may then sub divide each of these into english and foreign </s>
<s> not english thus getting four classes viz </s>
<s> old english old foreign new english new foreign </s>
<s> if we had begun by dividing into english and foreign and had then sub divided into old and new the four classes would have been english old english new foreign old foreign new </s>
<s> the reader will easily see that these are the very same four classes which we had before pg chapter iv </s>
<s> names the word thing which conveys the idea of thing without any idea of an adjunct represents any single thing </s>
<s> any other word or phrase which conveys the idea of thing with the idea of an adjunct represents any thing which possesses that adjunct it represents any member of the class to which that adjunct is peculiar </s>
<s> such word or phrase is called name and if there be an existing thing which it represents it is said to be name of that thing </s>
<s> for example the words thing treasure town and the phrases valuable thing material artificial thing consisting of houses and streets town lit with gas town paved with gold old english book just as class is said to be real or unreal according as there is or is not an existing thing in it so also name is said to be real or unreal according as there is or is not an existing thing represented by it </s>
<s> thus town lit with gas is real name town paved with gold is an unreal name every name is either substantive only or else phrase consisting of substantive and one or more adjectives or phrases used as adjectives </s>
<s> every name except thing may usually be expressed in three different forms the substantive thing and one or more adjectives or phrases used as adjectives conveying the ideas of the attributes pg substantive conveying the idea of thing with the ideas of some of the attributes and one or more adjectives or phrases used as adjectives conveying the ideas of the other attributes substantive conveying the idea of thing with the ideas of all the attributes </s>
<s> thus the phrase material living thing belonging to the animal kingdom having two hands and two feet is name expressed in form </s>
<s> if we choose to roll up together the substantive thing and the adjectives material living belonging to the animal kingdom so as to make the new substantive animal we get the phrase animal having two hands and two feet which is name representing the same thing as before expressed in form </s>
<s> and if we choose to roll up the whole phrase into one word so as to make the new substantive man we get name still representing the very same thing expressed in form name whose substantive is in the plural number may be used to represent either members of class regarded as separate things or whole class regarded as one single thing </s>
<s> thus when say some soldiers of the tenth regiment are tall or the soldiers of the tenth regiment are brave am using the name soldiers of the tenth regiment in the first sense and it is just the same as if were to point to each of them separately and to say this soldier of the tenth regiment is tall that soldier of the tenth regiment is tall and so on </s>
<s> but when say the soldiers of the tenth regiment are formed in square am using the phrase in the second sense and it is just the same as if were to say the tenth regiment is formed in square pg chapter </s>
<s> definitions it is evident that every member of species is also member of the genus out of which that species has been picked and that it possesses the differentia of that species </s>
<s> hence it may be represented by name consisting of two parts one being name representing any member of the genus and the other being the differentia of that species </s>
<s> such name is called definition of any member of that species and to give it such name is to define it </s>
<s> thus we may define treasure as valuable thing in this case we regard things as the genus and valuable as the differentia the following examples of this process may be taken as models for working others </s>
<s> note that in each definition the substantive representing member or members of the genus is printed in capitals </s>
<s> define treasure ans valuable thing </s>
<s> define treasures ans valuable things </s>
<s> define town ans material artificial thing consisting of houses and streets pg </s>
<s> define men ans material living things belonging to the animal kingdom having two hands and two feet or else animals having two hands and two feet </s>
<s> define london ans the material artificial thing which consists of houses and streets and has four million inhabitants or else the town which has four million inhabitants note that we here use the article the instead of because we happen to know that there is only one such thing </s>
<s> the reader can set himself any number of examples of this process by simply choosing the name of any common thing such as house tree knife making definition for it and then testing his answer by referring to any english dictionary pg book ii </s>
<s> propositions </s>
<s> chapter </s>
<s> propositions generally </s>
<s> introductory note that the word some is to be regarded henceforward as meaning one or more the word proposition as used in ordinary conversation may be applied to any word or phrase which conveys any information whatever </s>
<s> thus the words yes and no are propositions in the ordinary sense of the word and so are the phrases you owe me five farthings and don't such words as oh or never and such phrases as fetch me that book which book do you mean do not seem at first sight to convey any information but they can easily be turned into equivalent forms which do so viz </s>
<s> am surprised will never consent to it order you to fetch me that book want to know which book you mean but proposition as used in this first part of symbolic logic has peculiar form which may be called its normal form and if any proposition which we wish to use in an argument is not in normal form we must reduce it to such form before we can use it </s>
<s> pg proposition when in normal form asserts as to certain two classes which are called its subject and predicate either that some members of its subject are members of its predicate or that no members of its subject are members of its predicate or that all members of its subject are members of its predicate </s>
<s> the subject and the predicate of proposition are called its terms two propositions which convey the same information are said to be equivalent </s>
<s> thus the two propositions see john and john is seen by me are equivalent </s>
<s> normal form of proposition proposition in normal form consists of four parts viz the word some or no or all this word which tells us how many members of the subject are also members of the predicate is called the sign of quantity name of subject </s>
<s> the verb are or is </s>
<s> this is called the copula name of predicate </s>
<s> pg </s>
<s> various kinds of propositions proposition that begins with some is said to be particular it is also called proposition in note that it is called particular because it refers to part only of the subject proposition that begins with no is said to be universal negative it is also called proposition in proposition that begins with all is said to be universal affirmative it is also called proposition in note that they are called universal because they refer to the whole of the subject proposition whose subject is an individual is to be regarded as universal </s>
<s> let us take as an example the proposition john is not well </s>
<s> this of course implies that there is an individual to whom the speaker refers when he mentions john and whom the listener knows to be referred to </s>
<s> hence the class men referred to by the speaker when he mentions john is one member class and the proposition is equivalent to all the men who are referred to by the speaker when he mentions john are not well propositions are of two kinds propositions of existence and propositions of relation these shall be discussed separately </s>
<s> pg chapter ii </s>
<s> propositions of existence proposition of existence when in normal form has for its subject the class existing things </s>
<s> its sign of quantity is some or no </s>
<s> note that though its sign of quantity tells us how many existing things are members of its predicate it does not tell us the exact number in fact it only deals with two numbers which are in ascending order and or more it is called proposition of existence because its effect is to assert the reality </s>
<s> the real existence or else the imaginariness of its predicate </s>
<s> thus the proposition some existing things are honest men asserts that the class honest men is real </s>
<s> this is the normal form but it may also be expressed in any one of the following forms honest men exist some honest men exist the class honest men exists there are honest men there are some honest men </s>
<s> similarly the proposition no existing things are men fifty feet high asserts that the class men feet high is imaginary </s>
<s> this is the normal form but it may also be expressed in any one of the following forms men feet high do not exist no men feet high exist the class men feet high does not exist there are not any men feet high there are no men feet high pg chapter iii </s>
<s> propositions of relation </s>
<s> introductory proposition of relation of the kind to be here discussed has for its terms two specieses of the same genus such that each of the two names conveys the idea of some attribute not conveyed by the other </s>
<s> thus the proposition some merchants are misers is of the right kind since merchants and misers are specieses of the same genus men and since the name merchants conveys the idea of the attribute mercantile and the name misers the idea of the attribute miserly each of which ideas is not conveyed by the other name </s>
<s> but the proposition some dogs are setters is not of the right kind since although it is true that dogs and setters are specieses of the same genus animals it is not true that the name dogs conveys the idea of any attribute not conveyed by the name setters </s>
<s> such propositions will be discussed in part ii the genus of which the two terms are specieses is called the universe of discourse or more briefly the univ the sign of quantity is some or no or all </s>
<s> note that though its sign of quantity tells us how many members of its subject are also members of its predicate it does not tell us the exact number in fact it only deals with three numbers which are in ascending order or more the total number of members of the subject it is called proposition of relation because its effect is to assert that certain relationship exists between its terms </s>
<s> pg </s>
<s> reduction of proposition of relation to normal form the rules for doing this are as follows ascertain what is the subject ascertain what class we are talking about if the verb governed by the subject is not the verb are or is substitute for it phrase beginning with are or is ascertain what is the predicate ascertain what class it is which is asserted to contain some or none or all of the members of the subject if the name of each term is completely expressed </s>
<s> if it contains substantive there is no need to determine the univ but if either name is incompletely expressed and contains attributes only it is then necessary to determine univ in order to insert its name as the substantive </s>
<s> ascertain the sign of quantity arrange in the following order sign of quantity subject copula predicate </s>
<s> let us work few examples to illustrate these rules </s>
<s> some apples are not ripe the subject is apples the verb is are the predicate is not ripe as no substantive is expressed and we have not yet settled what the univ </s>
<s> is to be we are forced to leave blank let univ </s>
<s> be fruit the sign of quantity is some the proposition now becomes some apples are not ripe fruit pg none of my speculations have brought me as much as per cent the subject is my speculations the verb is have brought for which we substitute the phrase are that have brought </s>
<s> the predicate is that have brought let univ </s>
<s> be transactions the sign of quantity is none of the proposition now becomes none of my speculations are transactions that have brought me as much as per cent none but the brave deserve the fair to begin with we note that the phrase none but the brave is equivalent to no not brave the subject has for its attribute not brave but no substantive is supplied </s>
<s> so we express the subject as not brave the verb is deserve for which we substitute the phrase are deserving of </s>
<s> the predicate is deserving of the fair let univ </s>
<s> be persons the sign of quantity is no the proposition now becomes no not brave persons are persons deserving of the fair lame puppy would not say thank you if you offered to lend it skipping rope the subject is evidently lame puppies and all the rest of the sentence must somehow be packed into the predicate </s>
<s> the verb is would not say for which we may substitute the phrase are not grateful for the predicate may be expressed as not grateful for the loan of skipping rope let univ </s>
<s> be puppies the sign of quantity is all the proposition now becomes all lame puppies are puppies not grateful for the loan of skipping rope pg no one takes in the times unless he is well educated the subject is evidently persons who are not well educated no one evidently means no person </s>
<s> the verb is takes in for which we may substitute the phrase are persons taking in the predicate is persons taking in the times let univ </s>
<s> be persons the sign of quantity is no the proposition now becomes no persons who are not well educated are persons taking in the times my carriage will meet you at the station the subject is my carriage this being an individual is equivalent to the class my carriages note that this class contains only one member the verb is will meet for which we may substitute the phrase are that will meet the predicate is that will meet you at the station let univ </s>
<s> be things the sign of quantity is all the proposition now becomes all my carriages are things that will meet you at the station happy is the man who does not know what toothache means the subject is evidently the man note that in this sentence the predicate comes first at first sight the subject seems to be an individual but on further consideration we see that the article the does not imply that there is only one such man </s>
<s> hence the phrase the man who is equivalent to all men who </s>
<s> the verb is are the predicate is happy let univ </s>
<s> be men the sign of quantity is all the proposition now becomes all men who do not know what toothache means are happy men pg some farmers always grumble at the weather whatever it may be the subject is farmers the verb is grumble for which we substitute the phrase are who grumble the predicate is who always grumble let univ </s>
<s> be persons the sign of quantity is some the proposition now becomes some farmers are persons who always grumble at the weather whatever it may be no lambs are accustomed to smoke cigars the subject is lambs the verb is are the predicate is accustomed let univ </s>
<s> be animals the sign of quantity is no the proposition now becomes no lambs are animals accustomed to smoke cigars ca'n understand examples that are not arranged in regular order like those am used to the subject is examples that </s>
<s> the verb is ca'n understand which we must alter so as to have examples instead of as the nominative case </s>
<s> it may be expressed as are not understood by me the predicate is not understood by me let univ </s>
<s> be examples the sign of quantity is all the proposition now becomes all examples that are not arranged in regular order like those am used to are examples not understood by me pg </s>
<s> proposition of relation beginning with all is double proposition proposition of relation beginning with all asserts as we already know that all members of the subject are members of the predicate </s>
<s> this evidently contains as part of what it tells us the smaller proposition some members of the subject are members of the predicate </s>
<s> thus the proposition all bankers are rich men evidently contains the smaller proposition some bankers are rich men the question now arises what is the rest of the information which this proposition gives us in order to answer this question let us begin with the smaller proposition some members of the subject are members of the predicate and suppose that this is all we have been told and let us proceed to inquire what else we need to be told in order to know that all members of the subject are members of the predicate </s>
<s> thus we may suppose that the proposition some bankers are rich men is all the information we possess and we may proceed to inquire what other proposition needs to be added to it in order to make up the entire proposition all bankers are rich men let us also suppose that the univ </s>
<s> the genus of which both the subject and the predicate are specieses has been divided by the process of dichotomy into two smaller classes viz </s>
<s> the predicate the class whose differentia is contradictory to that of the predicate </s>
<s> thus we may suppose that the genus men of which both bankers and rich men are specieses has been divided into the two smaller classes rich men poor men pg now we know that every member of the subject is as shown at </s>
<s> member of the univ </s>
<s> hence every member of the subject is either in class or else in class </s>
<s> thus we know that every banker is member of the genus men </s>
<s> hence every banker is either in the class rich men or else in the class poor men also we have been told that in the case we are discussing some members of the subject are in class </s>
<s> what else do we need to be told in order to know that all of them are there </s>
<s> evidently we need to be told that none of them are in class </s>
<s> that none of them are members of the class whose differentia is contradictory to that of the predicate </s>
<s> thus we may suppose we have been told that some bankers are in the class rich men </s>
<s> what else do we need to be told in order to know that all of them are there </s>
<s> evidently we need to be told that none of them are in the class poor men hence proposition of relation beginning with all is double proposition and is equivalent to </s>
<s> gives the same information as the two propositions some members of the subject are members of the predicate no members of the subject are members of the class whose differentia is contradictory to that of the predicate </s>
<s> thus the proposition all bankers are rich men is double proposition and is equivalent to the two propositions some bankers are rich men no bankers are poor men pg </s>
<s> what is implied in proposition of relation as to the reality of its terms note that the rules here laid down are arbitrary and only apply to part of my symbolic logic proposition of relation beginning with some is henceforward to be understood as asserting that there are some existing things which being members of the subject are also members of the predicate </s>
<s> that some existing things are members of both terms at once </s>
<s> hence it is to be understood as implying that each term taken by itself is real </s>
<s> thus the proposition some rich men are invalids is to be understood as asserting that some existing things are rich invalids </s>
<s> hence it implies that each of the two classes rich men and invalids taken by itself is real proposition of relation beginning with no is henceforward to be understood as asserting that there are no existing things which being members of the subject are also members of the predicate </s>
<s> that no existing things are members of both terms at once </s>
<s> but this implies nothing as to the reality of either term taken by itself </s>
<s> thus the proposition no mermaids are milliners is to be understood as asserting that no existing things are mermaid milliners </s>
<s> but this implies nothing as to the reality or the unreality of either of the two classes mermaids and milliners taken by itself </s>
<s> in this case as it happens the subject is imaginary and the predicate real proposition of relation beginning with all contains see similar proposition beginning with some </s>
<s> hence it is to be understood as implying that each term taken by itself is real </s>
<s> thus the proposition all hy nas are savage animals contains the proposition some hy nas are savage animals </s>
<s> hence it implies that each of the two classes hy nas and savage animals taken by itself is real pg </s>
<s> translation of proposition of relation into one or more propositions of existence we have seen that proposition of relation beginning with some asserts that some existing things being members of its subject are also members of its predicate </s>
<s> hence it asserts that some existing things are members of both </s>
<s> it asserts that some existing things are members of the class of things which have all the attributes of the subject and the predicate </s>
<s> hence to translate it into proposition of existence we take existing things as the new subject and things which have all the attributes of the subject and the predicate as the new predicate </s>
<s> similarly for proposition of relation beginning with no </s>
<s> proposition of relation beginning with all is as shown in equivalent to two propositions one beginning with some and the other with no each of which we now know how to translate </s>
<s> let us work few examples to illustrate these rules </s>
<s> some apples are not ripe here we arrange thus some sign of quantity </s>
<s> existing things subject </s>
<s> are copula </s>
<s> not ripe apples predicate </s>
<s> or thus some existing things are not ripe apples pg some farmers always grumble at the weather whatever it may be here we arrange thus some existing things are farmers who always grumble at the weather whatever it may be no lambs are accustomed to smoke cigars here we arrange thus no existing things are lambs accustomed to smoke cigars none of my speculations have brought me as much as per cent here we arrange thus no existing things are speculations of mine which have brought me as much as per cent none but the brave deserve the fair here we note to begin with that the phrase none but the brave is equivalent to no not brave men we then arrange thus no existing things are not brave men deserving of the fair all bankers are rich men this is equivalent to the two propositions some bankers are rich men and no bankers are poor men here we arrange thus some existing things are rich bankers and no existing things are poor bankers work examples </s>
<s> pg book iii </s>
<s> the biliteral diagram </s>
<s> xy xy x'y x'y chapter </s>
<s> symbols and cells first let us suppose that the above diagram is an enclosure assigned to certain class of things which we have selected as our universe of discourse or more briefly as our univ </s>
<s> for example we might say let univ </s>
<s> be books and we might imagine the diagram to be large table assigned to all books the reader is strongly advised in reading this chapter not to refer to the above diagram but to draw large one for himself without any letters and to have it by him while he reads and keep his finger on that particular part of it about which he is reading pg secondly let us suppose that we have selected certain adjunct which we may call and have divided the large class to which we have assigned the whole diagram into the two smaller classes whose differenti are and not which we may call and that we have assigned the north half of the diagram to the one which we may call the class of things or the class and the south half to the other which we may call the class of things or the class </s>
<s> for example we might say let mean old so that will mean new and we might suppose that we had divided books into the two classes whose differenti are old and new and had assigned the north half of the table to old books and the south half to new books thirdly let us suppose that we have selected another adjunct which we may call and have subdivided the class into the two classes whose differenti are and and that we have assigned the north west cell to the one which we may call the xy class and the north east cell to the other which we may call the xy class </s>
<s> for example we might say let mean english so that will mean foreign and we might suppose that we had subdivided old books into the two classes whose differenti are english and foreign and had assigned the north west cell to old english books and the north east cell to old foreign books fourthly let us suppose that we have subdivided the class in the same manner and have assigned the south west cell to the x'y class and the south east cell to the x'y class </s>
<s> for example we might suppose that we had subdivided new books into the two classes new english books and new foreign books and had assigned the south west cell to the one and the south east cell to the other it is evident that if we had begun by dividing for and and had then subdivided for and we should have got the same four classes </s>
<s> hence we see that we have assigned the west half to the class and the east half to the class </s>
<s> pg thus in the above example we should find that we had assigned the west half of the table to english books and the east half to foreign books old old english foreign books books new new english foreign books books we have in fact assigned the four quarters of the table to four different classes of books as here shown the reader should carefully remember that in such phrase as the things the word things means that particular kind of things to which the whole diagram has been assigned </s>
<s> thus if we say let univ </s>
<s> be books we mean that we have assigned the whole diagram to books in that case if we took to mean old the phrase the things would mean the old books the reader should not go on to the next chapter until he is quite familiar with the blank diagram have advised him to draw </s>
<s> he ought to be able to name instantly the adjunct assigned to any compartment named in the right hand column of the following table </s>
<s> also he ought to be able to name instantly the compartment assigned to any adjunct named in the left hand column </s>
<s> to make sure of this he had better put the book into the hands of some genial friend while he himself has nothing but the blank diagram and get that genial friend to question him on this table dodging about as much as possible </s>
<s> the questions and answers should be something like this pg table </s>
<s> adjuncts compartments or cells of assigned to them classes north half </s>
<s> south west east xy north west cell </s>
<s> xy east x'y south west x'y east </s>
<s> adjunct for west half </s>
<s> </s>
<s> compartment for xy </s>
<s> north east cell </s>
<s> adjunct for south west cell </s>
<s> x'y </s>
<s> after little practice he will find himself able to do without the blank diagram and will be able to see it mentally in my mind's eye horatio while answering the questions of his genial friend </s>
<s> when this result has been reached he may safely go on to the next chapter </s>
<s> pg chapter ii </s>
<s> counters let us agree that red counter placed within cell shall mean this cell is occupied </s>
<s> there is at least one thing in it </s>
<s> let us also agree that red counter placed on the partition between two cells shall mean the compartment made up of these two cells is occupied but it is not known whereabouts in it its occupants are hence it may be understood to mean at least one of these two cells is occupied possibly both are our ingenious american cousins have invented phrase to describe the condition of man who has not yet made up his mind which of two political parties he will join such man is said to be sitting on the fence this phrase exactly describes the condition of the red counter </s>
<s> let us also agree that grey counter placed within cell shall mean this cell is empty </s>
<s> there is nothing in it </s>
<s> the reader had better provide himself with red counters and grey ones pg chapter iii </s>
<s> representation of propositions </s>
<s> introductory henceforwards in stating such propositions as some things exist or no things are things shall omit the word things which the reader can supply for himself and shall write them as some exist or no are </s>
<s> note that the word things is here used with special meaning as explained at </s>
<s> proposition containing only one of the letters used as symbols for attributes is said to be uniliteral </s>
<s> for example some exist no exist proposition containing two letters is said to be biliteral </s>
<s> for example some xy exist no are proposition is said to be in terms of the letters it contains whether with or without accents </s>
<s> thus some xy exist no are are said to be in terms of and pg </s>
<s> representation of propositions of existence let us take first the proposition some exist </s>
<s> note that this proposition is as explained at </s>
<s> equivalent to some existing things are things this tells us that there is at least one thing in the north half that is that the north half is occupied </s>
<s> and this we can evidently represent by placing red counter here represented by dotted circle on the partition which divides the north half </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be some old books exist similarly we may represent the three similar propositions some exist some exist and some exist </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these propositions would be some new books exist let us take next the proposition no exist </s>
<s> this tells us that there is nothing in the north half that is that the north half is empty that is that the north west cell and the north east cell are both of them empty </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing two grey counters in the north half one in each cell </s>
<s> the reader may perhaps think that it would be enough to place grey counter on the partition in the north half and that just as red counter so placed would mean this half is occupied so grey one would mean this half is empty </s>
<s> this however would be mistake </s>
<s> we have seen that red counter so placed would mean at least one of these two cells is occupied possibly both are hence grey one would merely mean at least one of these two cells is empty possibly both are </s>
<s> but what we have to represent is that both cells are certainly empty and this can only be done by placing grey counter in each of them </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be no old books exist pg similarly we may represent the three similar propositions no exist no exist and no exist </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be no new books exist let us take next the proposition some xy exist </s>
<s> this tells us that there is at least one thing in the north west cell that is that the north west cell is occupied </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing red counter in it </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be some old english books exist similarly we may represent the three similar propositions some xy exist some x'y exist and some x'y exist </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be some old foreign books exist let us take next the proposition no xy exist </s>
<s> this tells us that there is nothing in the north west cell that is that the north west cell is empty </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing grey counter in it </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be no old english books exist similarly we may represent the three similar propositions no xy exist no x'y exist and no x'y exist </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be no old foreign books exist pg we have seen that the proposition no exist may be represented by placing two grey counters in the north half one in each cell </s>
<s> we have also seen that these two grey counters taken separately represent the two propositions no xy exist and no xy exist </s>
<s> hence we see that the proposition no exist is double proposition and is equivalent to the two propositions no xy exist and no xy exist </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be no old books exist </s>
<s> hence this is double proposition and is equivalent to the two propositions no old english books exist and no old foreign books exist </s>
<s> representation of propositions of relation let us take first the proposition some are </s>
<s> this tells us that at least one thing in the north half is also in the west half </s>
<s> hence it must be in the space common to them that is in the north west cell </s>
<s> hence the north west cell is occupied </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing red counter in it </s>
<s> note that the subject of the proposition settles which half we are to use and that the predicate settles in which portion of it we are to place the red counter </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be some old books are english similarly we may represent the three similar propositions some are some are and some are </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be some old books are foreign pg let us take next the proposition some are </s>
<s> this tells us that at least one thing in the west half is also in the north half </s>
<s> hence it must be in the space common to them that is in the north west cell </s>
<s> hence the north west cell is occupied </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing red counter in it </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be some english books are old similarly we may represent the three similar propositions some are some are and some are </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be some english books are new we see that this one diagram has now served to represent no less than three propositions viz </s>
<s> some xy exist some are some are </s>
<s> hence these three propositions are equivalent </s>
<s> in the books example these propositions would be some old english books exist some old books are english some english books are old the two equivalent propositions some are and some are are said to be converse to each other and the process of changing one into the other is called converting or conversion </s>
<s> for example if we were told to convert the proposition some apples are not ripe we should first choose our univ </s>
<s> say fruit and then complete the proposition by supplying the substantive fruit in the predicate so that it would be some apples are not ripe fruit and we should then convert it by interchanging its terms so that it would be some not ripe fruit are apples pg similarly we may represent the three similar trios of equivalent propositions the whole set of four trios being as follows some xy exist some are some are </s>
<s> some xy exist some are some are </s>
<s> some x'y exist some are some are </s>
<s> some x'y exist some are some are </s>
<s> let us take next the proposition no are </s>
<s> this tell us that no thing in the north half is also in the west half </s>
<s> hence there is nothing in the space common to them that is in the north west cell </s>
<s> hence the north west cell is empty </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing grey counter in it </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be no old books are english similarly we may represent the three similar propositions no are and no are and no are </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be no old books are foreign let us take next the proposition no are </s>
<s> this tells us that no thing in the west half is also in the north half </s>
<s> hence there is nothing in the space common to them that is in the north west cell </s>
<s> that is the north west cell is empty </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing grey counter in it </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would be no english books are old similarly we may represent the three similar propositions no are no are and no are </s>
<s> the reader should make out all these for himself </s>
<s> in the books example these three propositions would be no english books are new pg we see that this one diagram has now served to present no less than three propositions viz </s>
<s> no xy exist no are no are hence these three propositions are equivalent </s>
<s> in the books example these propositions would be no old english books exist no old books are english no english books are old the two equivalent propositions no are and no are are said to be converse to each other </s>
<s> for example if we were told to convert the proposition no porcupines are talkative we should first choose our univ </s>
<s> say animals and then complete the proposition by supplying the substantive animals in the predicate so that it would be no porcupines are talkative animals and we should then convert it by interchanging its terms so that it would be no talkative animals are porcupines similarly we may represent the three similar trios of equivalent propositions the whole set of four trios being as follows no xy exist no are no are </s>
<s> no xy exist no are no are </s>
<s> no x'y exist no are no are </s>
<s> no x'y exist no are no are </s>
<s> let us take next the proposition all are </s>
<s> we know see </s>
<s> that this is double proposition and equivalent to the two propositions some are and no are each of which we already know how to represent </s>
<s> note that the subject of the given proposition settles which half we are to use and that its predicate settles in which portion of that half we are to place the red counter pg table ii </s>
<s> some exist no exist some exist no exist some exist no exist some exist no exist similarly we may represent the seven similar propositions all are all are all are all are all are all are and all are </s>
<s> let us take lastly the double proposition some are and some are each part of which we already know how to represent </s>
<s> similarly we may represent the three similar propositions some are and some are some are and some are some are and some are </s>
<s> the reader should now get his genial friend to question him severely on these two tables </s>
<s> the inquisitor should have the tables before him but the victim should have nothing but blank diagram and the counters with which he is to represent the various propositions named by his friend </s>

<s> some xy exist some are all are some are some xy exist some are all are some are some x'y exist some are all are some are some x'y exist some are all are some are no xy exist no are all are no are no xy exist no are all are no are no x'y exist no are all are no are no x'y exist no are all are no are some are some are and some are and some are some are some are and some are and some are pg chapter iv </s>
<s> interpretation of biliteral diagram when marked with counters the diagram is supposed to be set before us with certain counters placed upon it and the problem is to find out what proposition or propositions the counters represent </s>
<s> as the process is simply the reverse of that discussed in the previous chapter we can avail ourselves of the results there obtained as far as they go </s>
<s> first let us suppose that we find red counter placed in the north west cell </s>
<s> we know that this represents each of the trio of equivalent propositions some xy exist some are some are </s>
<s> similarly we may interpret red counter when placed in the north east or south west or south east cell </s>
<s> next let us suppose that we find grey counter placed in the north west cell </s>
<s> we know that this represents each of the trio of equivalent propositions no xy exist no are no are </s>
<s> similarly we may interpret grey counter when placed in the north east or south west or south east cell </s>
<s> pg next let us suppose that we find red counter placed on the partition which divides the north half </s>
<s> we know that this represents the proposition some exist similarly we may interpret red counter when placed on the partition which divides the south or west or east half </s>
<s> next let us suppose that we find two red counters placed in the north half one in each cell </s>
<s> we know that this represents the double proposition some are and some are </s>
<s> similarly we may interpret two red counters when placed in the south or west or east half </s>
<s> next let us suppose that we find two grey counters placed in the north half one in each cell </s>
<s> we know that this represents the proposition no exist </s>
<s> similarly we may interpret two grey counters when placed in the south or west or east half </s>
<s> lastly let us suppose that we find red and grey counter placed in the north half the red in the north west cell and the grey in the north east cell </s>
<s> we know that this represents the proposition all are </s>
<s> note that the half occupied by the two counters settles what is to be the subject of the proposition and that the cell occupied by the red counter settles what is to be its predicate pg similarly we may interpret red and grey counter when placed in any one of the seven similar positions red in north east grey in north west red in south west grey in south east red in south east grey in south west red in north west grey in south west red in south west grey in north west red in north east grey in south east red in south east grey in north east </s>
<s> once more the genial friend must be appealed to and requested to examine the reader on tables ii and iii and to make him not only represent propositions but also interpret diagrams when marked with counters </s>
<s> the questions and answers should be like this </s>
<s> represent no are </s>
<s> grey counter in </s>
<s> cell </s>
<s> </s>
<s> interpret red counter on </s>
<s> partition </s>
<s> </s>
<s> some exist </s>

<s> cell grey in </s>

<s> the triliteral diagram </s>
<s> xy xy xy xy xy xy x'y x'y x'y x'y x'y x'y chapter </s>
<s> symbols and cells first let us suppose that the above left hand diagram is the biliteral diagram that we have been using in book iii and that we change it into triliteral diagram by drawing an inner square so as to divide each of its cells into portions thus making cells altogether </s>
<s> the right hand diagram shows the result </s>
<s> the reader is strongly advised in reading this chapter not to refer to the above diagrams but to make large copy of the right hand one for himself without any letters and to have it by him while he reads and keep his finger on that particular part of it about which he is reading pg secondly let us suppose that we have selected certain adjunct which we may call and have subdivided the xy class into the two classes whose differenti are and and that we have assigned the </s>
<s> inner cell to the one which we may call the class of xym things or the xym class and the </s>
<s> outer cell to the other which we may call the class of xym things or the xym class </s>
<s> thus in the books example we might say let mean bound so that will mean unbound and we might suppose that we had subdivided the class old english books into the two classes old english bound books and old english unbound books and had assigned the </s>
<s> inner cell to the one and the </s>
<s> outer cell to the other thirdly let us suppose that we have subdivided the xy class the x'y class and the x'y class in the same manner and have in each case assigned the inner cell to the class possessing the attribute and the outer cell to the class possessing the attribute </s>
<s> thus in the books example we might suppose that we had subdivided the new english books into the two classes new english bound books and new english unbound books and had assigned the </s>
<s> inner cell to the one and the </s>
<s> outer cell to the other it is evident that we have now assigned the inner square to the class and the outer border to the class </s>
<s> thus in the books example we have assigned the inner square to bound books and the outer border to unbound books when the reader has made himself familiar with this diagram he ought to be able to find in moment the compartment assigned to particular pair of attributes or the cell assigned to particular trio of attributes </s>
<s> the following rules will help him in doing this arrange the attributes in the order </s>
<s> pg take the first of them and find the compartment assigned to it </s>
<s> then take the second and find what portion of that compartment is assigned to it </s>
<s> treat the third if there is one in the same way </s>
<s> for example suppose we have to find the compartment assigned to ym </s>
<s> we say to ourselves has the west half and has the inner portion of that west half again suppose we have to find the cell assigned to x'ym </s>
<s> we say to ourselves has the south half has the west portion of that south half </s>
<s> has the south west quarter and has the outer portion of that south west quarter the reader should now get his genial friend to question him on the table given on the next page in the style of the following specimen dialogue </s>

<s> representation of propositions in terms of and or of and </s>
<s> representation of propositions of existence in terms of and or of and let us take first the proposition some xm exist </s>
<s> note that the full meaning of this proposition is as explained at </s>
<s> some existing things are xm things this tells us that there is at least one thing in the inner portion of the north half that is that this compartment is occupied </s>
<s> and this we can evidently represent by placing red counter on the partition which divides it </s>
<s> in the books example this proposition would mean some old bound books exist or there are some old bound books similarly we may represent the seven similar propositions some xm exist some x'm exist some x'm exist some ym exist some ym exist some y'm exist and some y'm exist </s>
<s> pg let us take next the proposition no xm exist </s>
<s> this tells us that there is nothing in the inner portion of the north half that is that this compartment is empty </s>
<s> and this we can represent by placing two grey counters in it one in each cell </s>
<s> similarly we may represent the seven similar propositions in terms of and or of and viz </s>
<s> no xm exist no x'm exist </s>
<s> these sixteen propositions of existence are the only ones that we shall have to represent on this diagram </s>
<s> </s>
<s> representation of propositions of relation in terms of and or of and let us take first the pair of converse propositions some are some are we know that each of these is equivalent to the proposition of existence some xm exist which we already know how to represent </s>
<s> similarly for the seven similar pairs in terms of and or of and </s>
<s> let us take next the pair of converse propositions no are no are we know that each of these is equivalent to the proposition of existence no xm exist which we already know how to represent </s>
<s> similarly for the seven similar pairs in terms of and or of and </s>
<s> pg let us take next the proposition all are we know see </s>
<s> that this is double proposition and equivalent to the two propositions some are and no are each of which we already know how to represent </s>
<s> similarly for the fifteen similar propositions in terms of and or of and </s>
<s> these thirty two propositions of relation are the only ones that we shall have to represent on this diagram </s>
<s> the reader should now get his genial friend to question him on the following four tables </s>
<s> the victim should have nothing before him but blank triliteral diagram red counter and grey ones with which he is to represent the various propositions named by the inquisitor no are some xm exist </s>

<s> representation of two propositions of relation one in terms of and and the other in terms of and on the same diagram the reader had better now begin to draw little diagrams for himself and to mark them with the digits and instead of using the board and counters he may put to represent red counter this may be interpreted to mean there is at least one thing here and to represent grey counter this may be interpreted to mean there is nothing here </s>
<s> the pair of propositions that we shall have to represent will always be one in terms of and and the other in terms of and </s>
<s> when we have to represent proposition beginning with all we break it up into the two propositions to which it is equivalent </s>
<s> when we have to represent on the same diagram propositions of which some begin with some and others with no we represent the negative ones first </s>
<s> this will sometimes save us from having to put on fence and afterwards having to shift it into cell </s>
<s> let us work few examples </s>
<s> no are no are </s>
<s> let us first represent no are </s>
<s> this gives us diagram </s>
<s> then representing no are on the same diagram we get diagram </s>

<s> cell is empty we should be obliged to take the off the fence as it no longer has the choice of two cells and to put it into the inner </s>
<s> cell as in diagram </s>
<s> this trouble may be saved by beginning with no are as in diagram </s>

<s> interpretation in terms of and of triliteral diagram when marked with counters or digits the problem before us is given marked triliteral diagram to ascertain what propositions of relation in terms of and are represented on it </s>
<s> the best plan for beginner is to draw biliteral diagram alongside of it and to transfer from the one to the other all the information he can </s>
<s> he can then read off from the biliteral diagram the required propositions </s>
<s> after little practice he will be able to dispense with the biliteral diagram and to read off the result from the triliteral diagram itself </s>
<s> to transfer the information observe the following rules examine the </s>
<s> quarter of the triliteral diagram </s>
<s> if it contains in either cell it is certainly occupied and you may mark the </s>
<s> quarter of the biliteral diagram with </s>
<s> if it contains two one in each cell it is certainly empty and you may mark the </s>
<s> quarter of the biliteral diagram with </s>
<s> pg deal in the same way with the the and the </s>
<s> quarter </s>
<s> let us take as examples the results of the four examples worked in the previous chapters </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter only one of the two cells is marked as empty so we do not know whether the </s>
<s> quarter of the biliteral diagram is occupied or empty so we cannot mark it </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we find two so this quarter is certainly empty and we mark it so on the biliteral diagram </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we have no information at all </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we have not enough to use </s>
<s> we may read off the result as no are or no are whichever we prefer </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we have not enough information to use </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we find </s>
<s> this shows us that it is occupied so we may mark the </s>
<s> quarter on the biliteral diagram with </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we have not enough information to use </s>
<s> in the </s>
<s> quarter we have none at all </s>

<s> pg book </s>
<s> syllogisms </s>
<s> chapter </s>
<s> introductory when trio of biliteral propositions of relation is such that all their six terms are species of the same genus every two of them contain between them pair of codivisional classes the three propositions are so related that if the first two were true the third would be true the trio is called syllogism the genus of which each of the six terms is species is called its universe of discourse or more briefly its univ the first two propositions are called its premisses and the third its conclusion also the pair of codivisional terms in the premisses are called its eliminands and the other two its retinends </s>
<s> the conclusion of syllogism is said to be consequent from its premisses hence it is usual to prefix to it the word therefore or the symbol </s>
<s> pg note that the eliminands are so called because they are eliminated and do not appear in the conclusion and that the retinends are so called because they are retained and do appear in the conclusion </s>
<s> note also that the question whether the conclusion is or is not consequent from the premisses is not affected by the actual truth or falsity of any of the trio but depends entirely on their relationship to each other </s>
<s> as specimen syllogism let us take the trio no things are things no things are things </s>
<s> no things are things which we may write as explained at </s>
<s> thus no are no are </s>
<s> no are </s>
<s> here the first and second contain the pair of codivisional classes and the first and third contain the pair and and the second and third contain the pair and </s>
<s> also the three propositions are as we shall see hereafter so related that if the first two were true the third would also be true </s>
<s> hence the trio is syllogism the two propositions no are and no are are its premisses the proposition no are is its conclusion the terms and are its eliminands and the terms and are its retinends </s>
<s> hence we may write it thus no are no are </s>
<s> </s>
<s> no are </s>
<s> as second specimen let us take the trio all cats understand french some chickens are cats </s>
<s> some chickens understand french </s>
<s> these put into normal form are all cats are creatures understanding french some chickens are cats </s>
<s> some chickens are creatures understanding french </s>
<s> here all the six terms are species of the genus creatures also the first and second propositions contain the pair of codivisional classes cats and cats the first and third contain the pair creatures understanding french and creatures understanding french and the second and third contain the pair chickens and chickens </s>
<s> pg also the three propositions are as we shall see at </s>
<s> so related that if the first two were true the third would be true </s>
<s> the first two are as it happens not strictly true in our planet </s>
<s> but there is nothing to hinder them from being true in some other planet say mars or jupiter in which case the third would also be true in that planet and its inhabitants would probably engage chickens as nursery governesses </s>
<s> they would thus secure singular contingent privilege unknown in england namely that they would be able at any time when provisions ran short to utilise the nursery governess for the nursery dinner hence the trio is syllogism the genus creatures is its univ the two propositions all cats understand french and some chickens are cats are its premisses the proposition some chickens understand french is its conclusion the terms cats and cats are its eliminands and the terms creatures understanding french and chickens are its retinends </s>
<s> hence we may write it thus all cats understand french some chickens are cats </s>
<s> some chickens understand french pg chapter ii </s>
<s> problems in syllogisms </s>
<s> introductory when the terms of proposition are represented by words it is said to be concrete when by letters abstract to translate proposition from concrete into abstract form we fix on univ and regard each term as species of it and we choose letter to represent its differentia </s>
<s> for example suppose we wish to translate some soldiers are brave into abstract form </s>
<s> we may take men as univ and regard soldiers and brave men as species of the genus men and we may choose to represent the peculiar attribute say military of soldiers and to represent brave then the proposition may be written some military men are brave men some men are men omitting men as explained at </s>
<s> some are in practice we should merely say let univ </s>
<s> be men soldiers brave and at once translate some soldiers are brave into some are the problems we shall have to solve are of two kinds viz </s>
<s> given pair of propositions of relation which contain between them pair of codivisional classes and which are proposed as premisses to ascertain what conclusion if any is consequent from them given trio of propositions of relation of which every two contain pair of codivisional classes and which are proposed as syllogism to ascertain whether the proposed conclusion is consequent from the proposed premisses and if so whether it is complete these problems we will discuss separately </s>
<s> pg </s>
<s> given pair of propositions of relation which contain between them pair of codivisional classes and which are proposed as premisses to ascertain what conclusion if any is consequent from them the rules for doing this are as follows determine the universe of discourse </s>
<s> construct dictionary making and or and represent the pair of codivisional classes and or and or the other two </s>
<s> translate the proposed premisses into abstract form </s>
<s> represent them together on triliteral diagram </s>
<s> ascertain what proposition if any in terms of and is also represented on it </s>
<s> translate this into concrete form </s>
<s> it is evident that if the proposed premisses were true this other proposition would also be true </s>
<s> hence it is conclusion consequent from the proposed premisses </s>
<s> let us work some examples </s>
<s> no son of mine is dishonest people always treat an honest man with respect </s>
<s> taking men as univ we may write these as follows no sons of mine are dishonest men all honest men are men treated with respect </s>
<s> we can now construct our dictionary viz </s>
<s> honest sons of mine treated with respect </s>
<s> note that the expression sons of mine is an abbreviated form of the differentia of sons of mine when regarded as species of men the next thing is to translate the proposed premisses into abstract form as follows no are all are </s>
<s> pg next by the process described at </s>
<s> we represent these on triliteral diagram thus next by the process described at </s>
<s> we transfer to biliteral diagram all the information we can </s>
<s> the result we read as no are or as no are whichever we prefer </s>
<s> so we refer to our dictionary to see which will look best and we choose no are which translated into concrete form is no son of mine fails to be treated with respect </s>
<s> all cats understand french some chickens are cats </s>
<s> taking creatures as univ we write these as follows all cats are creatures understanding french some chickens are cats </s>
<s> we can now construct our dictionary viz </s>
<s> cats understanding french chickens </s>
<s> the proposed premisses translated into abstract form are all are some are </s>
<s> in order to represent these on triliteral diagram we break up the first into the two propositions to which it is equivalent and thus get the three propositions some are no are some are </s>
<s> the rule given at </s>
<s> would make us take these in the order </s>
<s> this however would produce the result pg so it would be better to take them in the order </s>
<s> nos </s>
<s> and give us the result here shown and now we need not trouble about no </s>
<s> as the proposition some are is already represented on the diagram </s>
<s> transferring our information to biliteral diagram we get this result we can read either as some are or some are </s>
<s> after consulting our dictionary we choose some are which translated into concrete form is some chickens understand french all diligent students are successful all ignorant students are unsuccessful </s>
<s> let univ </s>
<s> be students successful diligent ignorant </s>
<s> these premisses in abstract form are all are all are </s>
<s> these broken up give us the four propositions some are no are some are no are </s>
<s> which we will take in the order </s>
<s> representing these on triliteral diagram we get and this information transferred to biliteral diagram is here we get two conclusions viz </s>
<s> all are all are pg and these translated into concrete form are all diligent students are not ignorant learned all ignorant students are not diligent idle </s>
<s> see </s>
<s> of the prisoners who were put on their trial at the last assizes all against whom the verdict guilty was returned were sentenced to imprisonment some who were sentenced to imprisonment were also sentenced to hard labour </s>
<s> let univ </s>
<s> be the prisoners who were put on their trial at the last assizes who were sentenced to imprisonment against whom the verdict guilty was returned who were sentenced to hard labour </s>
<s> the premisses translated into abstract form are all are some are </s>
<s> breaking up the first we get the three some are no are some are </s>
<s> representing these in the order on triliteral diagram we get here we get no conclusion at all </s>
<s> you would very likely have guessed if you had seen only the premisses that the conclusion would be some against whom the verdict guilty was returned were sentenced to hard labour </s>
<s> but this conclusion is not even true with regard to the assizes have here invented </s>
<s> not true you exclaim </s>
<s> then who were they who were sentenced to imprisonment and were also sentenced to hard labour </s>
<s> they must have had the verdict guilty returned against them or how could they be sentenced well it happened like this you see </s>
<s> they were three ruffians who had committed highway robbery </s>
<s> when they were put on their trial they pleaded guilty </s>
<s> so no verdict was returned at all and they were sentenced at once will now work out in their briefest form as models for the reader to imitate in working examples the above four concrete problems </s>
<s> pg see </s>
<s> no son of mine is dishonest people always treat an honest man with respect univ </s>
<s> men honest my sons treated with respect </s>
<s> no are all are </s>
<s> no are </s>
<s> no son of mine ever fails to be treated with respect see </s>
<s> all cats understand french some chickens are cats </s>
<s> univ </s>
<s> creatures cats understanding french chickens </s>
<s> all are some are </s>
<s> some are </s>

<s> work examples </s>
<s> </s>
<s> </s>
<s> pg </s>
<s> given trio of propositions of relation of which every two contain pair of codivisional classes and which are proposed as syllogism to ascertain whether the proposed conclusion is consequent from the proposed premisses and if so whether it is complete the rules for doing this are as follows take the proposed premisses and ascertain by the process described at </s>
<s> what conclusion if any is consequent from them </s>
<s> if there be no conclusion say so </s>
<s> if there be conclusion compare it with the proposed conclusion and pronounce accordingly </s>
<s> will now work out in their briefest form as models for the reader to imitate in working examples six problems </s>
<s> all soldiers are strong all soldiers are brave </s>
<s> some strong men are brave univ </s>
<s> men soldiers strong brave </s>
<s> pg all are all are </s>
<s> some are </s>
<s> some are hence proposed conclusion is right </s>
<s> admire these pictures when admire anything wish to examine it thoroughly </s>
<s> wish to examine some of these pictures thoroughly univ </s>
<s> things admired by me these pictures things which wish to examine thoroughly </s>
<s> all are all are </s>
<s> some are </s>
<s> all are hence proposed conclusion is incomplete the complete one being wish to examine all these pictures thoroughly </s>
<s> none but the brave deserve the fair some braggarts are cowards </s>
<s> some braggarts do not deserve the fair univ </s>
<s> persons brave deserving of the fair braggarts </s>
<s> no are some are </s>
<s> some are </s>
<s> some are hence proposed conclusion is right </s>
<s> pg all soldiers can march some babies are not soldiers </s>
<s> some babies cannot march </s>
<s> univ </s>
<s> persons soldiers able to march babies </s>
<s> all are some are </s>
<s> some are there is no conclusion </s>
<s> all selfish men are unpopular all obliging men are popular </s>
<s> all obliging men are unselfish </s>
<s> univ </s>
<s> men popular selfish obliging </s>
<s> all are all are </s>
<s> all are </s>
<s> all are all are hence proposed conclusion is incomplete the complete one containing in addition all selfish men are disobliging </s>
<s> no one who means to go by the train and cannot get conveyance and has not enough time to walk to the station can do without running this party of tourists mean to go by the train and cannot get conveyance but they have plenty of time to walk to the station </s>
<s> this party of tourists need not run univ </s>
<s> persons meaning to go by the train and unable to get conveyance having enough time to walk to the station needing to run these tourists </s>
<s> pg no are all are </s>
<s> all are there is no conclusion </s>
<s> here is another opportunity gentle reader for playing trick on your innocent friend </s>
<s> put the proposed syllogism before him and ask him what he thinks of the conclusion </s>
<s> he will reply why it's perfectly correct of course </s>
<s> and if your precious logic book tells you it isn't don't believe it </s>
<s> you don't mean to tell me those tourists need to run </s>
<s> if were one of them and knew the premisses to be true should be quite clear that needn't run and should walk and you will reply but suppose there was mad bull behind you and then your innocent friend will say hum </s>
<s> ha </s>
<s> must think that over bit you may then explain to him as convenient test of the soundness of syllogism that if circumstances can be invented which without interfering with the truth of the premisses would make the conclusion false the syllogism must be unsound review tables viii pp </s>
